content:
BTW, @WG-compiler-nll, I think it'd be useful to do an NLL "retrospective" -- basically a 1hr look back on what went right/wrong and maybe a good way to look towards the future. I'd be up for trying to schedule it. The main question I have is :

  • Try to do it this week in December?
  • Or wait until January?

But maybe I should let doodle handle that.

Thoughts?
I like the idea, I can do December or January.

I would probably run it kind of like the first compiler steering meeting:

  • Before hand, we each fill out a survey
  • I'll compile those
  • We can then vote briefly on which topics to drill into more
  • And I'll prepare a summary at the end
Yeah, I wouldn't do the voting on the survey the same as the first steering meeting though :mischievous:
heh, yeah, that was a bit chaotic. I'm open to suggestions =)
we could use Ye Olde Emoji Vote on Zulip
it's better for me december but in january it may work too, a bit more complicated to schedule
I haven't been with nll for that long so won't have much thoughts. But this is a great thing to do, look back and Dec is a great time for it( or Jan) :slight_smile:
